DataElement.preferredName: Patient Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Consent Other Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the reason a participant withdrew from the Qualify of Life portion of a study that is different from the options presented.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Consent Other Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient's withdrawal (when the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn) of consent for a companion study (a study that is secondary to another study) involving quality of life (the subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life)._When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Ancillary Study Quality of Life Consent Withdrawn Other Reason
Property.preferredDefinition: Studies which are secondary to another study.:The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.:When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A study that is secondary to another study.

The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.
When the permission to do something is rescinded or withdrawn.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Reason for withdrawal from Qu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Reason for withdrawal from Quality of Life portion of study, Other

DataElement.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CRF Standards Initiative consent modules
